com.flamingOctoIronman.events

Interface Event

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreEvent, InitializationEvent

    public interface Event
    This interface requires that events have certain methods that are required to ensure proper subscribing and publishing of the Event
    Author:
    Quint
    See Also:
    CoreEvent

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean compareClass(java.lang.String s)
      Compares the String to the name of the class that implements this method.
      void publish()
      Publish this Event to all of it's subscribers.
      void subscribe(java.lang.Object subscriber)
      Adds the Object to the list of objects that will get notified when the event is published.
      void unsubscribe(java.lang.Object subscriber)
      Removes the Object from the list of objects taht will get notified when the event is published

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        void publish()
             throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Publish this Event to all of it's subscribers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - This should never occur but is checked
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This should never occur but is checked
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - This should never occur but is checked

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(java.lang.Object subscriber)
        Adds the Object to the list of objects that will get notified when the event is published.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - Object that is subscribing to the event

      • unsubscribe

        void unsubscribe(java.lang.Object subscriber)
        Removes the Object from the list of objects taht will get notified when the event is published
        Parameters:
        subscriber - Object to be removed

      • compareClass

        boolean compareClass(java.lang.String s)
        Compares the String to the name of the class that implements this method.

        This should ALWAYS only be implemented by a final class.

        Parameters:
        s - simplified name of the Class to compare to.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Strings are the same
